unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Check the Polls
question_text: National polls for a political candidate were being compared between two different polling companies. Company $1$ randomly polled $32$ people and found $22$ planning to vote for the candidate. Company $2$ randomly polled $34$ people and found $31$ planning to vote for the candidate. A person was commissioned to analyze the results by creating a confidence interval for the difference between the two proportions.  Which of the following pairs of checks would fail to verify the conditions for the confidence interval?
